unnormalised: **Manufacturing Sector Focuses on Enhanced Quality Control**
normalised: **Manufacturing Sector Focuses on Enhanced Quality Control**

unnormalised: New Delhi: Indian manufacturers are increasingly prioritizing robust quality control measures to compete globally. Dr. Sharma, Director of the National Institute of Quality Assurance (NIQA), emphasized the need for zero-defect manufacturing at a recent industry summit.
normalised: New Delhi: Indian manufacturers are increasingly prioritizing robust quality control measures to compete globally. Doctor Sharma, Director of the N I Q A, emphasized the need for zero-defect manufacturing at a recent industry summit.

unnormalised: "Maintaining high standards is crucial for 'Make in India' to succeed," Dr. Sharma stated. This comes amidst growing concerns about product recalls and customer dissatisfaction.
normalised: "Maintaining high standards is crucial for 'Make in India' to succeed," Doctor Sharma stated. This comes amidst growing concerns about product recalls and customer dissatisfaction.

unnormalised: Several companies are investing heavily in advanced testing equipment and training programs for their workforce. Tata Steel, for example, recently announced a Rs. 50 crore investment in upgrading its quality control labs.
normalised: Several companies are investing heavily in advanced testing equipment and training programs for their workforce. Tata Steel, for example, recently announced a rupee fifty crore investment in upgrading their quality control labs.

unnormalised: Smaller businesses are also adopting lean manufacturing principles to streamline processes and minimize errors. A workshop held in Coimbatore focused on reducing defects in textile manufacturing using statistical process control. The new facility occupies 10,000 sq ft.
normalised: Smaller businesses are also adopting lean manufacturing principles to streamline processes and minimize errors. A workshop held in Coimbatore focused on reducing defects in textile manufacturing using statistical process control. The new facility occupies ten thousand square feet.

unnormalised: Supply chain visibility is another key area. Integrating blockchain technology is helping companies track products from raw material sourcing to final delivery. Experts believe these measures will boost consumer confidence and enhance the reputation of Indian-made goods. The program targets a 15% reduction in manufacturing defects by FY25.
normalised: Supply chain visibility is another key area. Integrating blockchain technology is helping companies track products from raw material sourcing to final delivery. Experts believe these measures will boost consumer confidence and enhance the reputation of Indian-made goods. The program targets a fifteen percent reduction in manufacturing defects by fiscal year twenty five.
